bibl.title: S.W Hall v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Thurston } SS.
In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Olympia, for the Counties of Thurston, Lew- is, Mason, and Chehalis.
In the matter of the application of S.W. Hall for a Writ of Habeas Corpus } Writ of Habeas Corpus
The President of the United States to William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County Washington Territory Greeting

We command you, that you have the body of S.W. Hall by you impris- oned and detained, as it is said, tog- ether with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention by what- soever name said S.W. Hall shall be called or charged, before Roger S Greene Esquire Judge of the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory at the Court room of the District Court of said District now in session at Kalama in Cowlitz County W.T. on the 4th day of January 1879 at 10 o'clock A.M. of that day or as soon thereafter as may be pos- sible, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said S.W. Hall. And have you then and there this writ.
Witness Honorable Roger S Greene Judge of said District Court this 6th day of January 1879 at Olympia W.T.
Attest my hand the seal of said Court this 6th day of January AD 1879 R.G. O'Bruin Clerk

Appears William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County W.T. and makes return upon this writ as follows - That the said (petitioner) S.W. Hall is detained and imprisoned by me under the name of Geo H. Holliday by virtue and authority of a warrant issued by the Governor of Washington Territory, that he the said Hall was arrested on the fifth day of January 1879, and herewith being, and have the body of the said S.W. Hall in this court as required by this writ William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County W.T.
District Court, Second Judicial District Washington Territory. Holding Terms at Olympia.
In the matter of the application of S.W. Hall for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed January 8th 1879 R.G. O'Bruin Clerk By H.H. Holt Deputy
